purpose: Terminal table formatter with ANSI-aware padding, column auto-sizing, zebra striping, and per-cell styling
keyExports: TableRenderer - Main table rendering class with constructor and fluent APIs
buildColumns - Build column definitions from a declarative registry
formatters - Built-in formatter factories for percent, bytes, and uptime
Column - Type for column definitions with styling and formatting options
ColumnRegistry - Type for declarative column property maps
Options - Type for table rendering configuration
ColorType - Union type for flexible color specifications
StyleFn - Type for ANSI styling functions
ColorSpec - Type for foreground/background color specs

keyPatterns.name: Column Registry Pattern
keyPatterns.description: Define columns declaratively with ColumnRegistry, then build with buildColumns() for cleaner code

keyPatterns.name: Fluent API Pattern
keyPatterns.description: Chain methods like .column(), .data(), .padding(), .headerStyle() for incremental table building

keyPatterns.name: Per-Cell Styling
keyPatterns.description: Use Column.color callback to apply dynamic styling based on cell value and row data

keyPatterns.name: Zebra Striping
keyPatterns.description: Use rowStyles array with two StyleFn entries for alternating row backgrounds

architecture.flow: Column definitions → TableRenderer → render() → string array → print()
architecture.keyDesign: Separation of concerns: Column<T> defines structure, TableRenderer handles layout and styling, terminal utilities handle ANSI-aware operations
